page.title: 03 Glasgow Cathedral
page.content: Dedicated to St. Kentigern or Mungo, it is one of only two mediaeval Cathedrals in Scotland to survive in a relatively intact condition.It was built in stages between the 12th and 15th centuries in the early pointed Gothic style. The present Minister is Dr. William Morris. When the Royal family visit they sit in the Royal Pew which bears their crest. There is a specially-designed carpet which shows the Glasgow Coat of Arms.The Nurses' Chapel has been recently restored and the new tapestry in the lower church depicts scenes from the book of Genesis. German stained glass removed at the end of World War II due to anti-Nazi feeling has recently been discovered in the cellars and may be restored.
